title.value: Co-developing The Canadian MPS Registry: A longitudinal rare disease patient registry
title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned in the research paper.
title.quote: Co-developing The Canadian MPS Registry: A longitudinal rare disease patient registry

extractions.description: This paper discusses the development of a patient registry for mucopolysaccharidosis (MPS), highlighting key values and objectives for enhancing research, understanding the disease, and facilitating treatments. It focuses on the governance structure, data collection, and participant involvement, aiming to improve care and outcomes for MPS patients.

type.justification: The paper discusses the development of a registry and the framework around it rather than empirical results or experiments.
type.quote: Due to the rarity of mucopolysaccharidoses (MPS), there is a paucity of evidence from which to base treatment decisions.

name.justification: The primary focus is on the development of a rare disease patient registry for MPS.
name.quote: The rigorous collection of standardized longitudinal outcomes within a patient registry that is not product-specific can facilitate research to enhance understanding of natural history and evaluate intervention effectiveness.

name.justification: The paper addresses research related to rare diseases like MPS through the use of patient registries.
name.quote: The Canadian MPS Society and the INFORM RARE research network co-developed The Canadian MPS Registry.

name.justification: An aspect of the paper involves managing data collected from patients within the registry.
name.quote: Participants own their own data and have control over its use, including sharing with external researchers.
